page.title: 01LURGASHALL AND DISTRICT
page.content: The area is one of gently undulating countryside being about two thirds cultivated interspread with one third woodland which if it was ever cultivated has not been so for many years. Most of the cultivated land is grass-land mainly for sheep with some cattle. There are a few fields down to crops in general for use as winter feedstock for the animals, the grass-land producing the necessary hay. Most of the farms except on the Eastern side are tenant farms owned by The Leconfield Estate. Near the centre of the area is the village or Lurgashall which has a good local community with a pub, church and village hall. These together with some old houses are situated around a very atractive village green upon which cricket is played in the Summer. There is a sprinkling of housing over the
